Estimate wind speed profile as in NicheMapR.

Source: R/TempWindProfileFunctions.R
wind_speed_profile.Rd

This function allows you to estimate wind speed (m/s) at a specified height (m). Estimates a single, unsegmented wind velocity using the MICRO routine from NicheMapR as described in Kearney and Porter 2016. Source: Kearney MR and Porter WP. 2016. NicheMapR – an R package for biophysical modelling: the microclimate model. Ecography 40:664-674. Section 5. Vertical air temperature and wind speed profiles, p11

wind_speed_profile(u_r, zr, z0, z)

Arguments

u_r

is wind velocity at reference height in m/s.
zr

is initial reference height in m.
z0

is surface roughness in m.
z

is height to scale to in m.

Value

wind speed (m/s)

Details

Calculates wind speed at a specified height

See also

Other microclimate functions: air_temp_profile_neutral, air_temp_profile_segment, air_temp_profile, degree_days, diurnal_radiation_variation, diurnal_temp_variation_sineexp, diurnal_temp_variation_sinesqrt, diurnal_temp_variation_sine, estimate_radiation, monthly_solar_radiation, partition_solar_radiation, surface_roughness, wind_speed_profile_neutral, wind_speed_profile_segment

Examples

if (FALSE) {
wind_speed_profile(u_r=0.1, zr=0.1, z0=0.2, z=0.15)
}
